The Range Briefing prepares participants for the activity and provides clear and concise safety related information (rules of the range, boundaries, etc.). The briefing has several component parts:

Download the Range Briefing Job Aid from the reference section to use during your practical certification assessment.

 

The RSO can also use the briefing to assign participants into relays, and to provide directions for concurrent activities (training that occurs for those waiting to shoot).

Range Briefing

•Welcome and introduction of range staff;

 

•Overview of the range layout and facilities;

 

•Safety rules;

 

•Type of activity, and course of fire;

 

•Review of Safety Precautions for an air rifle and immediate action and stoppages procedures;

 

•Brief review of range commands – must include review of actions on “Cease fire!” command;

 

•Emergency Response procedure and location of first aid kit and first aider(s);

 

•Any additional items required by Range Standing orders or local conditions; and

 

•Requirement for air rifle handling test before shooting.

Click on the photo to watch a video of a range briefing. (approx 8 mins)

Introduce any Assistant RSO, range staff and coaches, and briefly describe their responsibilities.
